meanings.definition: The condition of being able to see objects clearly only when they are close to the eyes.
meanings.sent1: Her nearsightedness made it difficult for her to read road signs from a distance.
meanings.sent2: His nearsightedness meant he had to sit at the front of the classroom to see the board clearly.
meanings.sent3: The nearsightedness of the detective led to some comical mishaps during the investigation.
meanings.sent4: His nearsightedness in understanding people's emotions often caused misunderstandings.
meanings.sent5: The nearsightedness of the telescope limited its ability to see distant galaxies clearly.

meanings.definition: A common vision problem in which distant objects appear blurry.
meanings.sent1: The doctor prescribed glasses to correct her nearsightedness and improve her vision.
meanings.sent2: His nearsightedness made it challenging for him to recognize faces from far away.
meanings.sent3: The nearsightedness of the camera lens created a unique blur effect in the photographs.
meanings.sent4: Her nearsightedness in financial matters prevented her from seeing the big picture.
meanings.sent5: The nearsightedness of the map made it hard to navigate unfamiliar roads.
